version_description:
* Backups: You can export or restore your entire Trails database (tracks, waypoints, and images) in one step
* Photo sharing reliability has been improved

* Improved thumbnails for system search results (Spotlight)
* Waypoint photos can be shared or saved
* Recordings can be started without a countdown from your Apple Watch by force touch
* Fixes a crash in the detail statistics for tracks without valid timestamps
* Stability improvements when exporting GPX files with many photos

* Fixes Wi-Fi sharing
* Fixes step counter bug when continuing segments

* Fixes Wi-Fi sharing
* Fixes step counter bug when continuing segments

* Replaces MapQuest map style with Roadmap and Atlas styles
* Improves app stability while recording
* Small bugfixes
Fixes Health integration for new users
* Fixes altitude calculations that may have prevented the detail screen from opening for some tracks.

* [1.35] Removes EveryTrail integration as EveryTrail has discontinued its service
* [1.34] Fixes altitude calculations that may have prevented the detail screen from opening for some tracks.

• Improved recording screen: Larger buttons, more statistics, shortcut to switch map styles

• New Apple Watch app: Interaction via Digital Crown, Trails Complications, activity selection, faster graphs display, workouts incl. heart rate monitoring can be started from the iOS app, live heart rates are shown in the iOS app (watchOS 3 only)

• Siri: Start or stop recordings with Siri – specify your preferred activity type, or name a track that you want to resume (iOS 10 only)

• New widget: Live statistics and graphs while recording (iOS 10 only)

Please note: The watch app is only available for watchOS 3.

* Stability and performance improvements of the Apple Watch app

* Small bugfixes, including the display of heart rate graphs

* We have added language support for Colognian – change your iPhone's preferred language to Colognian and enjoy the translations and special statistics

We are working on full support for the Apple Watch Series 2 to allow recordings without your iPhone within reach. If you enjoy Trails and would like to support our continued development efforts, please consider leaving a rating or review on the App Store. If you have any questions regarding Trails, please send an email to support@trails.io.

* Fixes a bug when exporting calories to Health. Calories tracking requires a paired Apple Watch within reach.

* Discards wrong and inaccurate coordinates that were occasionally appended to the end of recordings on the Apple Watch Series 2

* Fixes a bug when exporting large Trails backups

If you enjoy Trails and would like to support our continued development efforts, please consider leaving a rating or review on the App Store. If you have any questions regarding Trails, please send an email to support@trails.io.

• Fixes recording alerts – you can make Trails announce your current statistics again (Trails Pro required). We have optimized speech output, alerts are easier to configure, and Trails can read out a summary of your top statistics.

• Fixes the countdown sound when starting a recording

• Changes the default length units to Miles in the UK. The default units are always used when recording on an Apple Watch Series 2.

• Other minor improvements and fixes

If you enjoy Trails and would like to support our continued development efforts, please consider leaving a rating or review on the App Store. If you have any questions regarding Trails, please send an email to support@trails.io.

• Extended system search ("Spotlight") integration: Search for "Waypoint" or a particular waypoint type, and find the option to create a new waypoint at your current position along your existing waypoints and photos

• Fixes minor display issues

If you enjoy Trails and would like to support our continued development efforts, please consider leaving a rating or review on the App Store. If you have any questions regarding Trails, please send an email to support@trails.io.

• Fixes sound dimming issue when countdown sound is enabled
• Further bug fixes and improvements

• Dashboard: Trails 3.0 displays summaries across your different activities, filtered by tags and date ranges.

• Tags: Organize your tracks by tagging related recordings. Tags are displayed in the list, and can be used to filter the dashboard and track list.

• Smart location filters: Your paths provide more detail when making turns and when coming to a standstill, Trails records less trackpoints when moving in a straight line at constant speed, and battery usage was optimized. Make sure you use the automatic recorder settings to use the new smart filters.

• Improves reliability when syncing tracks from your Series 2 watch to the phone

• Fixes duplicate Health entries

If you enjoy Trails and would like to support our continued development efforts, please consider leaving a rating or review on the App Store. If you have any question regarding Trails, please send an email to support@trails.io.

• General performance and stability improvements
• Improve reliability of calorie tracking via an Apple Watch

If you enjoy Trails and would like to support our continued development efforts, please consider leaving a rating or review on the App Store. If you have any question regarding Trails, please send an email to support@trails.io.

• Trails is ready for iOS 11 and watchOS 4
• Workout routes can be exported to Health (iOS 11 only)
• Import tags can be removed to include imported tracks in dashboard summaries and export them to Health
• Other bugfixes and improvements

If you enjoy Trails and would like to support our continued development efforts, please consider leaving a rating or review on the App Store. If you have any question regarding Trails, please send an email to support@trails.io.

• Introducing Trails Vector Maps, an entirely new map style based on OpenStreetMap data: Trails Vector Maps can be downloaded for offline usage, support various display options (including topographic information), and improve readability compared to the previous OpenStreetMap-based map styles. Trails Vector Maps require Trails Pro.
• Fixed issue when importing large GPX files
• Updated web viewer (Trails.io & WiFi sharing) for improved statistics display

If you enjoy Trails and would like to support our continued development efforts, please consider leaving a rating or review on the App Store. If you have any question regarding Trails, please send an email to support@trails.io.

• Introducing Trails Vector Maps, an entirely new map style based on OpenStreetMap data: Trails Vector Maps can be downloaded for offline usage, support various display options (including topographic information), and improve readability compared to the previous OpenStreetMap-based map styles. Trails Vector Maps require Trails Pro.
• Fixed issue when importing large GPX files
• Updated web viewer (Trails.io & WiFi sharing) for improved statistics display

If you enjoy Trails and would like to support our continued development efforts, please consider leaving a rating or review on the App Store. If you have any question regarding Trails, please send an email to support@trails.io.

• Export of ski and snowboard downhill distances to Health (iOS 11.2 and watchOS 4.2 and later)
• The watch app remembers the most-recently used activity type

If you enjoy Trails and would like to support our continued development efforts, please consider leaving a rating or review on the App Store.

• Fixed live Health updates (heart rate and active energy) on watchOS 4.2
• Fixed track editor and heatmap on iOS 11.2
• Fixed alert rule deletion on iOS 11

• The watch app remembers the most-recently used activity type

• Minor bugfixes and improvement.
• Additional privacy policy prompts (GDPR)
Minor bug fixes

- Fixes a bug during imports
